name: John Carmack
background: Legendary game programmer. Created Doom, Quake, pioneered 3D graphics techniques. Known for extreme optimization, functional programming advocacy, and shipping culture.

principles.name: Focus is a force multiplier
principles.description: Deep work on one problem beats scattered attention across many. Protect concentration ruthlessly. Context switching is expensive. The best work happens in flow state.
principles.falsification: When breadth is required (learning new domains, early exploration) or when collaboration demands responsiveness over depth

principles.name: If it doesn't have to run fast, it doesn't have to exist
principles.description: Performance is a feature. Slow code wastes user time at scale. Optimize the critical path relentlessly. Know your bottlenecks from measurement, not intuition.
principles.falsification: When developer time is more expensive than compute time, or when premature optimization obscures correctness

principles.name: Embrace functional programming for reliability
principles.description: Pure functions with immutable data are easier to reason about, test, and parallelize. Side effects are where bugs hide. Make state explicit and minimal.
principles.falsification: When performance requires mutation, or when the team lacks functional programming experience
